alert.note: Alert for Des Moines; Lee (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 7:34PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Hancock, Henderson, Warren, northern McDonough, southeastern Mercer, central Des Moines and northeastern Lee Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 734 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Galesburg to 6 miles northwest of Gladstone. Movement was south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Gladstone around 740 PM CDT. Burlington around 745 PM CDT. West Burlington around 750 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Gulf Port, Carman, Dallas City, Terre Haute and Disco. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
